thinking.disposable_income: West Lawn has a median household income of $69,647, with about 37% of households earning less than $50,000. The per capita income of $25,786 suggests moderate disposable income levels, making residents somewhat sensitive to additional transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With a significant portion of households in middle-income brackets and large average household size of 3.4, discretionary spending capacity is moderate. Higher sales taxes would impact household budgets meaningfully
thinking.accessibility: The community heavily relies on cars with 87.7% of households having at least one vehicle. 63.4% drive alone to work, while only 9.8% use transit. This suggests strong preference for driving despite cost implications
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized proposals with lower sales tax (0.5-1.0%) to protect discretionary spending. 2. Given high car dependency, favored moderate driving fees ($0.50) over high fees ($1.00) to avoid excessive burden. 3. Selected proposals with moderate transit fares ($1.25) to balance transit service quality with affordability. 4. Considered travel time improvements for both modes given mixed transportation needs. 5. Aimed to maintain reasonable costs for majority car-using population while improving transit service
